TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Annotation extends System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartNamedElement

Docs.summary: Defines properties and methods common to all annotations. This is an abstract class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Annotations are commonly used to comment or elaborate on chart elements such as data points. Annotations can also be used to draw custom shapes.
By default, annotations are positioned using relative coordinates, with (0,0) representing the top-left corner, and (100,100) representing the bottom-right corner of the chart image. It is also possible to switch from this relative coordinate system to a system that uses axis values. With an axis coordinate system, X and Y, which represent the position of the top-left corner of an annotation, are set using X axis and Y axis values, instead of values that range from 0-100.
There are two ways to use axis values when you specify the position and size of an annotation:
- Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> or both of these annotation properties to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisY%2A> property values of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.ChartArea%2A> object.
- Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property to anchor the annotation to a data point. In this case, its positioning is automatically calculated.
All annotations are derived from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation> class, which can be used to set attributes common to all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation> objects, such as color, position, anchoring and so forth.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This is the default constructor and should not be used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Annotation is an abstract class and cannot be created directly. To create a new annotation object, use constructors of classes such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LineAnnotation>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.RectangleAnnotation>, and the like.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.ContentAlignment Alignment { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content alignment of an annotation.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the content alignment.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to align text for <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.RectangleAnnotation>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.EllipseAnnotation> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CalloutAnnotation> objects, and to align a non-scaled image inside an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ImageAnnotation> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowAnchorMoving { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the end user is allowed to move the annotation anchor using a mouse.
Docs.value: if the annotation anchor may be moved; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowMoving { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the end user is allowed to move an annotation using a mouse.
Docs.value: if the annotation may be moved; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowPathEditing { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the end user is allowed to move the points of a polygon annotation using a mouse.
Docs.value: if the polygon annotation's points may be moved; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property needs to be set to `true` to free draw a polyline annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowResizing { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the end user is allowed to resize an annotation using a mouse.
Docs.value: if the annotation may be resized; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowSelecting { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the end user is allowed to select an annotation using a mouse.
Docs.value: if the annotation may be selected; otherwise .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool AllowTextEditing { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the text in an annotation may be edited when the end user double clicks the text.
Docs.value: if the annotation text may be edited; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.ContentAlignment AnchorAlignment { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of an annotation to the anchor point.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that represents the alignment of the annotation to the anchor point.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The annotation must be anchored by either using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property, or by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorY%2A> properties. Its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Y%2A> properties must be set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.AnchorPointUITypeEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data point to which an annotation is anchored.
Docs.value: A object to which an annotation is anchored.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The annotation is anchored to the X and Y values of the specified data point, and automatically uses the same axes coordinates as the data point.
To automatically position the annotation relative to the anchor point, make sure its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.X%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Y%2A> properties are set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorAlignment%2A> property can be used to change the automatic position alignment of the annotation to the anchor point. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorOffsetX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorOffsetY%2A> properties may be used to add extra spacing.
When you use this property, make sure the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorY%2A> properties are set to Double.NaN, as they have precedence.
Set this value to `null` to disable annotation anchoring to a data point.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string AnchorDataPointName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of a data point to which an annotation is anchored.
Docs.value: A value that represents the name of the data point that an annotation is anchored to.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double AnchorOffsetX { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the offset from the anchor point for the X position of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the offset of the X position from the anchor point.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The annotation must be anchored using either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorX%2A> property, and its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.X%2A> property must be set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double AnchorOffsetY { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the offset from the anchor point for the Y position of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the offset of the Y position from the anchor point.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The annotation must be anchored using either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorY%2A> property, and its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Y%2A> property must be set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double AnchorX { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the X coordinate to which the annotation is anchored.
Docs.value: A value that represents the X coordinate an annotation is anchored to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The annotation is anchored to the X coordinate and is specified in relative chart or axes coordinates, depending on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> property value.
To automatically position an annotation relative to an anchor point, make sure its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.X%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorAlignment%2A> property can be used to change the automatic position alignment of the annotation to the anchor point. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorOffsetX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorOffsetY%2A> properties may be used to add extra spacing.
This property has a higher priority than the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property.
Set this value to <xref:System.Double.NaN> to disable annotation anchoring to the value.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double AnchorY { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Y coordinate to which the annotation is anchored.
Docs.value: A value that represents the Y coordinate an annotation is anchored to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The annotation is anchored to the Y coordinate and is specified in relative chart or axes coordinates, depending on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> property value.
To automatically position an annotation relative to an anchor point make sure its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Y%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Double.NaN>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorAlignment%2A> property can be used to change the automatic position alignment of the annotation to the anchor point. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorOffsetX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorOffsetY%2A> properties may be used to add extra spacing.
This property has a higher priority than the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property.
Set this value to <xref:System.Double.NaN> to disable annotation anchoring to the value.

Docs.summary: Gets the group, if any, to which the annotation belongs.
Docs.value: An object that represents the group which the annotation belongs to.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an annotation's type name.
Docs.value: The annotation type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to get the name of each annotation type, for example, Line, Rectangle, Ellipse, and so forth.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.AnnotationAxisUITypeEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the X axis to which an annotation is attached.
Docs.value: An object to which the annotation is attached.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an annotation is attached to an axis, its X position is always specified in axes coordinates. To also define the size of an annotation in axes coordinates, make sure the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.IsSizeAlwaysRelative%2A> property is set to `false`.
Set this value to `null` to disable attachment to the axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string AxisXName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the X axis to which an annotation is attached.
Docs.value: A value that represents the name of the X axis which an annotation is attached to.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Y axis to which an annotation is attached.
Docs.value: An object to which this annotation is attached.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an annotation is attached to an axis, its Y position is always specified in axes coordinates. To also define the size of an annotation in axes coordinates, make sure the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.IsSizeAlwaysRelative%2A> property is set to `false`.
Set to `null` to disable annotation attachment to an axis.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string AxisYName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Y axis which an annotation is attached to.
Docs.value: A value that represents the name of the Y axis that an annotation is attached to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property does not apply to line-type annotations, image annotations and text annotations.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.value: A value used to draw an annotation background.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Two colors are used to draw the gradients, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackColor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackSecondaryColor%2A>.
This property does not apply to line-type annotations, image annotations and text annotations.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the hatching style of an annotation background.
Docs.value: A value used to draw the background.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Two colors are used to draw the hatching, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackColor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackSecondaryColor%2A>.
This property does not apply to line-type annotations, image annotations and text annotations.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackSecondaryColor { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the secondary color of an annotation background.
Docs.value: A value used to draw an annotation background with hatching or gradient fill.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The secondary color is used with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackColor%2A> when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackHatchStyle%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BackGradientStyle%2A> is used.
This property does not apply to line-type annotations, image annotations and text annotations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BeginPlacement() cil managed

Docs.summary: Begins the end user placement of an annotation using the mouse.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When this method is called, the end user is allowed to place an annotation using the mouse.
Placement finishes when the end user specifies all required points, or when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.EndPlacement%2A> method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double Bottom { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the bottom boundary of an annotation position.
Docs.value: A value that represents the position of the bottom boundary of an annotation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To use axes coordinates, anchor an annotation to a data point using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property, or set the annotation axes using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> properties and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.IsSizeAlwaysRelative%2A> property to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BringToFront() cil managed

Docs.summary: Brings an annotation to the front of all annotations.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ClipToChartArea { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the chart area to which an annotation is clipped.
Docs.value: A that represents the name of an existing chart area to which an annotation is clipped.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the chart area name is specified, an annotation will only be drawn inside the plotting area of the chart area specified. All parts of the annotation outside of the plotting area will be clipped.
To disable chart area clipping, set the property to <xref:System.String.Empty>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both unmanaged and managed resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and, optionally, managed resources.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EndPlacement() cil managed

Docs.summary: Ends the end user placement of an annotation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method ends an annotation placement operation previously started by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.BeginPlacement%2A> method call.
Calling this method is not required, because placement will automatically end when an end user enters all required points. However, it is useful when an annotation placement operation needs to be aborted for some reason.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Font Font { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the font to use for the text of an annotation.
Docs.value: A object used to draw the annotation text.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("System.Windows.Forms.Design.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorEditor, System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text color of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value used for the text color of an annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double Height { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the height of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the height of an annotation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The height of an annotation can be a negative value, in which case the annotation orientation is switched.
Annotation width can be in relative chart coordinates or in axes coordinates. Chart relative coordinates are used by default.
To use axes coordinates, anchor an annotation to a data point using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property, or set the annotation axes using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> properties and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.IsSizeAlwaysRelative%2A> property to `false`.
Set the width to <xref:System.Double.NaN> to achieve automatic size calculation for annotations with text. The size will automatically be calculated based on the annotation text and font size.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsSelected { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that determines if an annotation is selected.
Docs.value: if the annotation is selected; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsSizeAlwaysRelative { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the size of an annotation is always defined in relative chart coordinates.
Docs.value: if the and of an annotation are always expressed in relative chart coordinates; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The height and width of an annotation may be set in relative chart or in axes coordinates. Relative chart coordinates are the default.
To express the size of an annotation in axes coordinates, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.IsSizeAlwaysRelative%2A> property to `false`. Then anchor the annotation to a data point or set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color LineColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the line color of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value used to draw an annotation's line.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the line style of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value used to draw the line style of an annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int LineWidth { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the line width of an annotation.
Docs.value: An value that defines the line width, in pixels, of an annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the unique name of an annotation.
Docs.value: A that represents the unique name of an annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ResizeToContent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resizes an annotation according to its content size.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Sets the annotation width and height to fit the specified text.
This method applies to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAnnotation>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.RectangleAnnotation>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.EllipseAnnotation> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.CalloutAnnotation> objects only.
> [!NOTE] > This method requires that the annotation be added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AnnotationCollection> to function correctly.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the right boundary position of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the position of the right boundary of an annotation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To use axes coordinates, anchor an annotation to a data point using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property, or set the annotation axes using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> properties and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.IsSizeAlwaysRelative%2A> property to `false`.

Docs.value: An value that represents the size of the shadow.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the smart label style of an annotation.
Docs.value: An object that represents an annotation's smart labels style properties.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Smart labels are used to prevent an annotation from overlapping the data point labels and other annotations.
> [!NOTE] > Data point labels must also have smart labels enabled.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text style of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value used to draw the text of an annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ToolTip { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip text for an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the tooltip text for an annotation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Special keywords can be used in the text when an annotation is anchored to a data point using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Visible { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether an annotation is visible.
Docs.value: if the annotation is visible; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width, in pixels, of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the width of an annotation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Height%2A> property description.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double X { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the X coordinate of an annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the X coordinate of an annotation's position.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The X coordinate of an annotation is specified in relative chart coordinates or in axes coordinates. Relative chart coordinates are used by default.
To use axes coordinates, anchor an annotation to a data point using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property, or set the annotation axes using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> properties.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.X%2A> position to <xref:System.Double.NaN> to automatically calculate position when the annotation has been anchored using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorY%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double Y { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Y coordinate of the annotation.
Docs.value: A value that represents the Y coordinate of an annotation's position.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Y coordinate of an annotation is specified in relative chart coordinates or in axes coordinates. Relative chart coordinates are used by default.
To use axes coordinates, anchor an annotation to a data point using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property, or set the annotation axes using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisX%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AxisY%2A> properties.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.Y%2A> position to <xref:System.Double.NaN> to automatically calculate the position when the annotation has been anchored using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorDataPoint%2A> property or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Annotation.AnchorY%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string YAxisName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Y axis to which an annotation is attached.
Docs.value: A value that represents the name of the Y axis which an annotation is attached to.
